headline.main: CURBS ON NEGROES LAID TO AIR FORCES; W.H. Hastie Says He Resigned as Aide to Stimson Because of Discriminatory Policies HITS SEGREGATED TRAINING And Aviation Squadrons for Enlisted Men Do Labor Work Mostly, He Alleges

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 -- The Army Air Forces were accused today of "reactionary policies and discriminatory practices" against Negroes in a statement by William H Hastie, former Federal judge and law-school dean, explaining his resignation as civilian aide to Secretary Stimson.
abstract: Cites Army Air Forces discrimination against Negroes as resignation cause
